intro: Ocotea brachybotrya, commonly known as the short-fruited ocotea, is a member of the Lauraceae family and is native to the tropical rainforests of South America. It is a small to medium-sized evergreen tree that typically grows to a height of 10–20 meters. The plant is characterized by its aromatic, glossy leaves and small, clustered flowers that are often white or pale green. Its fruits are small, globose berries that turn from green to dark purple as they mature. Ocotea brachybotrya is valued for its essential oils and is sometimes used in traditional medicine.
